title: Parliament sits on four days next week
content: The Party Leaders decided yesterday (17), to hold Parliament sittings from 22 to 25 February, Leader of the House Dinesh Gunawardena said.The Party Leadersâ€™ meeting was held yesterday (17) morning.  Regulations under the Licensing of Produce Brokers Act (ii) and Regulations under the Rubber Replanting Subsidy Act are expected to be passed in the House on 22 February. On 23 February, an Adjournment Motion presented by the Opposition will be taken up for the debate. Gunawardena said that Regulations under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, Four Regulations under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, Order under the Strategic Development Projects Act, Fauna and Flora Protection (Amendment) Bill and Order under the Felling of Trees (Control) Act will be debated on 24 February. The next day (25) is allocated for Votes of Condolence on the Late MPs Ananda Ratnayake, R.R.W. Rajapakse, Somaweera Chandrasiri, P.B. Dissanayake and H.R. Mithrapala.
